answers.answer: Hi,Cause of arm numbness may be one of the following -Injury to a nerve -- for example, a neck injury may cause you to feel numbness anywhere along your arm or hand, Pressure on the spinal nerves, such as from a herniated disk ,Pressure on peripheral nerves from enlarged blood vessels, tumors, scar tissue, or infection ,Lack of blood supply to an area , Other medical conditions, including: Carpal tunnel syndrome (pressure on a nerve at the wrist) ,Diabetes ,Migraines ,Multiple sclerosis ,Seizures ,Stroke ,Transient ischemic attack (TIA), sometimes called a "mini-stroke" ,Underactive thyroid ,Raynaud's phenomenon ,Abnormal levels of calcium, potassium, or sodium in your body ,A lack of vitamin B12 or other vitamin ,Use of certain medications or Toxic nerve damage due to lead, alcohol, or tobacco . Please consult a physician and neurologist for the investigations and diagnosis . Hope this helps you . Take care and regards !

question: For the last two weeks i have been having numbness and a pins and needles feeling in my left arm running down the ulnar side of my forearm and the last two fingers on my hand. The sensation is persistent and constant. I have an appointment with my doctor, but this feeling is driving me crazy. Could I please get an idea of what any possible causes could be and what kind of treatment is available for this type of problem?
title: Concerned about numbness in left arm and hand
